Post:
"I've lost all my friends because I can't trust anyone. Every time we hang out, I feel like they're just waiting for the perfect moment to hurt me or take advantage of me. It's like they're all just pretending to be my friends, but really, they're just waiting for their chance to strike. I've been burned too many times in the past, and now I can't even stand the thought of being around people. They're all just a bunch of snakes, waiting to pounce on me at any moment."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the individual's isolation and distrust to their own perceived vulnerability and the supposed malicious intentions of others. The individual sees themselves as being inherently weak and vulnerable, and therefore, they believe that others are always plotting against them. This attributional style is stable because it is a long-lasting belief that is not easily changed by external factors or evidence to the contrary.
Transferred_Post: "I've lost all my friends because I feel like I can't trust anyone. I've had negative experiences in the past that have made me feel vulnerable and wary of others' intentions. Right now, I'm struggling to connect with people because I'm afraid of getting hurt again. It's like I'm stuck in a cycle of distrust and fear, and I don't know how to break free from it."
